text: Nectandra spicata is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is endemic to Rio de Janeiro city, in natural areas of the Atlantic Forest ecoregion, within Rio de Janeiro state, southeastern Brazil. It is on the IUCN Red List, threatened by habitat loss in the city. ==References== spicata Category:Endemic flora of Brazil Category:Flora of Atlantic Forest (biome) Category:Flora of Rio de Janeiro (state) Category:Data deficient plants Category:Taxa named by Carl Meissner Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Nectandra spicata
